creator: pilf_b@yahoo.com
text:
complete-ant-cmd.pl should ignore the description section of the "ant -p" output.  Currently complete-ant-cmd.pl will incorrectly suggest non-targets that it incorrectly parsed out of the build file description.


For example, take the following ant -p output:

$ ant -p
Buildfile: build.xml

Description of build file.

    Some indented description text.
    
Main targets:

 target1  Description of target1
 target2  Description of target2


Then, complete-ant-cmd.pl will parse out the text "Some" as a build target, like this:

$ ant <TAB><TAB>
Some     target1  target2  


Expected result:  I would expect the tab completion to only show the targets that appear after the "Main targets:" section begins.  Anything before "Main targets:" should be ignored.



For reference, the buildfile used in the example above is:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<project name="foo">
    <description>
Description of build file.

    Some indented description text.
    </description>

    <target name="target1" description="Description of target1"/>

    <target name="target2" description="Description of target2"/>

</project>

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: fixed with Christian Schmidt's patch for bug 57542 with git commit 33d20f4
